TopicTitle: A theory for modded Xbox KSP...

Articles.Content: I have a theory that if you go to Microsoft's website Xbox: play anywhere, you can install KSP on your PC/Computer for no additional price and add mods into the files. I'm not sure if this can be SAVED on your Xbox KSP but, then again, this is a theory. I'm still in the development of testing this and am not sure if this is going to work or not but i am confident. Please try this out if you can.

If it's like most stuff on Xbox, it won't work. The game files (everything really) about the Xbox file system is pretty much locked away and inaccessible. The fact that many of the best mods  also include plugin code that needs to execute on the CPU would be another big hurdle, possibly insurmountable even beyond technical reasons (licensing, liability).   

Our best hope would be that someday M$ lets us stream from our PCs to our consoles, but I bet pigs will fly before that happens.

another thing we can do is take the memory drive (or whatever the living hell is in there) and put it in adapters into our computer and access files that way. still not sure if that will work but it won't (or will) hurt to try

Sounds like a lot of trouble and possibly you letting the majick smoke out of your Xbox drive.  Why not just play the game on PC and cast it to your TV or something? 

 

I'm 90% sure all the data you'd be interested in is encrypted, besides.
I mean it might be possible to mod Ksp on Xbox but near impossible you would also need a mod.
it wouldn´t hurt to find out
